title: py-cutadapt - spack won't load python dependencies automatically
body:
Hi

I created a new package using "spack create."  How fun!  This is such great software!!!

This is the template:

```
from spack import *

class PyCutadapt(PythonPackage):
    """Cutadapt finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequence from your high-throughput sequencing reads."""

    homepage = "https://pypi.python.org/pypi/cutadapt"
    url      = "https://pypi.python.org/packages/4b/a0/caf0a418d64a69da12c0f5ede20830f0b7dba2d29efa3f667f1ce69e78da/cutadapt-1.13.tar.gz"

    version('1.13', '2d2d14e0c20ad53d7d84b57bc3e63b4c')

    depends_on('py-setuptools',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-xopen',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-six',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-packaging',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-pyparsing',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-appdirs',        type=('build', 'run'))
    depends_on('py-pip',        type=('build', 'run'))

```

```
[root@node123 ~]# spack info py-cutadapt
PythonPackage:    py-cutadapt
Homepage:         https://pypi.python.org/pypi/cutadapt

Safe versions:  
    1.13    https://pypi.python.org/packages/4b/a0/caf0a418d64a69da12c0f5ede20830f0b7dba2d29efa3f667f1ce69e78da/cutadapt-1.13.tar.gz

Variants:
    None

Installation Phases:
    build    install

Build Dependencies:
    py-appdirs  py-packaging  py-pip  py-pyparsing  py-setuptools  py-six  py-xopen  python

Link Dependencies:
    python

Run Dependencies:
    py-appdirs  py-packaging  py-pip  py-pyparsing  py-setuptools  py-six  py-xopen  python

Virtual Packages: 
    None

Description:
    Cutadapt finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and
    other types of unwanted sequence from your high-throughput sequencing
    reads.

```

Though when I run spack load the run dependencies are not included so I have to load them individually.

I tried spack activate per [https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basic_usage.html#specs-dependencies](url) but that does not work.
